snippet: Some authors, like the novelist James Patterson, are producing 12 or more books a year to satisfy readers who are increasingly used to on-demand entertainment.
abstract: Advent of the e-book has accelerated the pace of the book-publishing industry, with publishers pressing authors to produce material as quickly as possible to satisfy demand; impatient consumers have become accustomed to downloading new titles instantly, and publishers believe it is imperative to keep authors' names in the public spotlight.
lead_paragraph: Some authors, like the novelist James Patterson, are producing 12 or more books a year to satisfy readers who are increasingly used to on-demand entertainment.

headline.seo: In E-Reader Age of Writer’s Cramp, a Book a Year Is Slacking
